title: Final_Project_VAA
text:
Hello, Welcome to our Final Project for Visual Analytics
Here you will find our proposal, our shiny dashboard and other important things.

title: World Happiness Report Analysis
text:
Happiness is a key measure of societal well-being, influenced by both economic (e.g., GDP per capita) and non-economic factors (e.g., social support, freedom, and governance). However, understanding how these factors interact remains a challenge.
This project aims to analyze the strongest predictors of happiness using data from the World Happiness Report and develop an interactive visualization tool to explore these relationships. By making happiness data more accessible and insightful, this study supports evidence-based decision-making for policymakers and researchers seeking to enhance well-being worldwide.

title: World Happiness Report Analysis
text:
Data Collection & Processing

Source: World Happiness Report 2024 (Chapter 2 Appendix)
Key variables:

Economic Indicators: GDP per capita, Life Expectancy
Social Indicators: Social Support, Freedom, Generosity
Governance Indicators: Perceptions of Corruption
Well-being Measures: Happiness Score, Positive/Negative Affect

title: World Happiness Report Analysis
text:
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)

Descriptive Statistics: Summary statistics of key variables.
Univariate & Bivariate Visualizations:

Histograms & Density Plots – Distribution of Happiness Scores

Boxplots – Comparison of happiness scores across regions

Scatter Plots – Relationships between key indicators and happiness


Correlation Analysis: Identifying the strongest relationships among factors.
Geospatial Analysis: Mapping happiness scores across countries.


# Placeholder for EDA visualizations

title: World Happiness Report Analysis
text:
Confirmatory Data Analysis (CDA)

Regression Analysis: Identifying the strongest predictors of happiness.
Feature Importance Analysis: Using machine learning techniques.
Clustering Analysis: Grouping similar countries based on happiness determinants.
Longitudinal Analysis: Tracking changes in happiness over time.


# Placeholder for statistical modeling

title: World Happiness Report Analysis
text:
Time Series & Forecasting

Trend Analysis: Examining how happiness has evolved over time.
Time Series Decomposition: Identifying trend and seasonal effects.
Predictive Modeling: Forecasting future happiness scores using ARIMA or Exponential Smoothing.
